oil-removal.title: Oil-containing wastewater treatment
oil-removal.shortDesc: Ozonation of industrial wastewater for oil product removal
oil-removal.content:
Ozonation is a highly effective method for treating oil-containing wastewater from industrial plants. The technology achieves discharge standards without reagents or secondary pollution.

Oil products in wastewater pose a serious environmental threat: 1 liter of oil can pollute up to 1 million liters of water. The maximum allowable concentration of oil products for discharge into fishery water bodies is 0.05 mg/L.

Ozone oxidizes oil products to carbon dioxide and water, ensuring deep destruction of pollutants. Treatment efficiency reaches 95–99% at initial oil product concentrations of 5–50 mg/L.

The technology is used at refineries, transport depots, shipyards, metallurgical plants and any facilities with oil-containing effluents.

efficiency.label: Treatment efficiency
efficiency.description: Removal of oil products from wastewater

intro.paragraph1: Wastewater from industrial facilities contaminated with oil products represents one of the most serious environmental problems. One liter of oil can pollute up to 1 million liters of water, creating a film that prevents gas exchange and threatens the death of aquatic ecosystems.
intro.paragraph2: Ozonation is an advanced method for deep treatment of oil-containing wastewater, ensuring destruction of hydrocarbons to carbon dioxide and water. Unlike traditional methods (flotation, sorption, biological treatment), ozonation provides complete mineralization of pollutants without formation of secondary waste.

regulatory.title: Regulatory requirements

highlight.title: Maximum allowable concentration
highlight.text: Maximum allowable concentration of oil products for discharge into fishery water bodies is 0.05 mg/L (GOST 17.1.3.07-82). For discharge into municipal sewerage — 4.0 mg/L. Exceeding the limit entails environmental fees and fines up to 2 million rubles.

regulatory.paragraph: Ozonation ensures compliance with current regulations:
items: SanPiN 2.1.5.980-00 — Hygienic requirements for surface water protection
GOST 17.1.3.07-82 — Rules for water quality control of water bodies
Ministry of Agriculture Order No. 552 — Water quality standards for fishery water bodies
Federal Law No. 7-FZ "On Environmental Protection"
Government Decree No. 644 — Rules for cold water supply and wastewater disposal

mechanism.title: Mechanism of oil product oxidation by ozone
mechanism.paragraph: Ozone is a powerful oxidizer with an oxidation-reduction potential of 2.07 V (compared to 1.36 V for chlorine). When interacting with oil products, oxidative destruction reactions occur:
items: Cleavage of long-chain hydrocarbons to short-chain
Oxidation of aromatic compounds with opening of benzene ring
Formation of intermediate products: aldehydes, ketones, carboxylic acids
Complete mineralization to CO₂ and H₂O with sufficient ozone dose
Destruction of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAH)
mechanism.tableCaption: Kinetics of oil product oxidation by ozone

infoBox.title: Oxidative destruction vs. sorption
infoBox.text: Unlike activated carbon, which only concentrates pollutants and requires regeneration or disposal, ozonation destroys oil product molecules, eliminating formation of secondary waste.

technology.title: Treatment process scheme
technology.paragraph: Industrial ozonation installation for oil-containing wastewater includes several treatment stages to achieve maximum efficiency:

steps.title: Preliminary mechanical treatment
steps.description: Removal of suspended solids, settling in oil traps. Reduction of oil product concentration to 30-50 mg/L.

steps.title: Flotation with ozone-air mixture
steps.description: Supply of ozone-air mixture (5-10 mg/L) through ejectors. Flotation of emulsified oil products.

steps.title: Ozonation contact chamber
steps.description: Deep oxidation of dissolved oil products. Ozone dose 3-5 mg per 1 mg of oil products. Contact time 20-30 minutes.

steps.title: Degassing and post-treatment
steps.description: Removal of excess ozone and oxidation products. If necessary — filtration through activated carbon.

steps.title: Quality control
steps.description: Automatic monitoring of oil product concentration at outlet. Regulation of ozone dose according to sensor readings.

manufacturing.title: Production air treatment
manufacturing.shortDesc: Air purification and disinfection in production facilities
manufacturing.content:
Air ozonation at production sites addresses disinfection of work areas, odor removal, neutralization of harmful substances and compliance with occupational health standards.

In production facilities, concentrations of microorganisms and harmful substances can far exceed sanitary norms. Ozonation reduces microbial load by 80–95% and oxidizes volatile organic compounds.

The technology is effective for food production, pharmaceutical plants, packaging facilities, warehouses and any sites with strict air quality requirements.

Industrial ozone generators provide capacity from 10 to 1000 g/h, enabling treatment of spaces from 100 to 50,000 m³.

intro.paragraph1: Air quality at production facilities directly affects personnel health, product quality and compliance with sanitary standards. In production facilities, concentrations of microorganisms, dust and harmful substances can far exceed permissible levels.
intro.paragraph2: Ozonation is a comprehensive air treatment technology providing disinfection, deodorization and oxidation of volatile organic compounds. Industrial ozone generators with capacity from 10 to 1000 g/h enable treatment of spaces from 100 to 50,000 m³.

warning.title: Safety requirements:
warning.text: Ozone MPC in work zones is 0.1 mg/m³ (maximum single) and 0.03 mg/m³ (shift average) according to GN 2.2.5.3532-18. Facility treatment is conducted in the absence of personnel with subsequent ventilation to residual concentration <0.03 mg/m³.

mechanism.title: Mechanism of ozone action on air pollutants
mechanism.paragraph: Ozone is the strongest oxidizer capable of destroying a wide range of production air pollutants:
items: Bacteria, viruses, fungi and spores — oxidative destruction of cell membranes
Volatile organic compounds (VOCs) — oxidation to CO₂ and H₂O
Hydrogen sulfide (H₂S) — oxidation to sulfates
Ammonia (NH₃) — oxidation to nitrates and water
Odorants — destruction of unsaturated bonds in molecules

highlight.title: Ozone vs. UV disinfection:
highlight.text: Unlike UV lamps, effective only in direct radiation zones, ozone spreads throughout the entire facility volume, penetrating hard-to-reach areas: crevices, ventilation systems, equipment interior spaces.

applications.title: Industrial ozonation application areas
applications.paragraph: The technology is in demand at facilities with high air quality requirements:

table.caption: Application industries and specific tasks
rows: Disinfection, odor removal, extended shelf life
Sterility of clean rooms classes A-D
Disinfection of packaging materials and air

steps.title: Shock disinfection (10-50 mg/m³)
steps.description: Used for deep treatment after repairs, mold contamination, sanitization after infection outbreaks. Conducted in the absence of personnel with 60-120 minute exposure.

steps.title: Regular treatment (2-5 mg/m³)
steps.description: Preventive ozonation during night shifts or technical breaks. Treatment time 30-60 minutes, ventilation 30-45 minutes.

steps.title: Continuous low-dose ozonation (0.02-0.05 mg/m³)
steps.description: Maintaining sanitary conditions in the presence of personnel. Concentration below MPC, constant circulation of ozonated air through ventilation system.

steps.title: Local work zone treatment
steps.description: Spot ozonation of areas with high microbial load. Application of mobile ozonators with directed supply.

table.caption: Ozonator capacity calculation for production facilities

ventilation.title: Integration with ventilation systems
ventilation.paragraph: For large production facilities, optimal solution is integration of ozonators with existing ventilation system:
items: Ozone injection into supply air duct — uniform distribution throughout facility
Recirculation air treatment — microbial load reduction
Exhaust air ozonation — odor removal before atmospheric discharge
Local ventilation with ozonation — treatment of high contamination zones

highlight.title: Energy resource savings:
highlight.text: Disinfection of recirculation air with ozone allows reducing fresh supply air share from 100% to 30-50%, reducing heating/cooling costs by 40-60%.

voc.title: Volatile organic compound neutralization
voc.paragraph: At facilities using solvents, paints, adhesives, VOC concentrations can exceed MPC by 5-20 times. Ozonation oxidizes organic compounds to safe products:

table.caption: Oxidation of typical production facility VOCs

highlight.title: Combined methods:
highlight.text: For high VOC concentrations, effective combination of ozonation with catalytic oxidation. Ozone activates catalyst at 100-150°C instead of 300-400°C for thermal oxidation.

safety.title: Safety system for ozonation
safety.paragraph: Industrial ozonation systems are equipped with multi-level safety system:
items: Ozone concentration sensors with emergency shutdown at >0.1 mg/m³
Automatic generation stop when facility doors open
Light and sound alarms during treatment
Timer with automatic shutdown after treatment time
Residual ozone destructor with 99.9% efficiency
Personnel access lockout during high-concentration treatment

highlight.title: Safety protocol:
highlight.text: Before personnel entry into treated facility, ozone concentration must be reduced to <0.03 mg/m³. Natural ozone decay time: 20-40 minutes. Forced ventilation reduces time to 10-15 minutes.
